content:
Sure, here's an updated table with 10 Science Fiction novels that explore the theme of extending lifespan or immortality:

| Book Title | Author | Description | Review Quote |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| The Immortalists | Chloe Benjamin | Four siblings learn the exact date of their deaths | "A literary page-turner" - New York Times Book Review |
| The Postmortal | Drew Magary | A cure for aging is discovered, allowing people to live indefinitely | "A fascinating, terrifying look at a very real future" - Scott Smith, author of "The Ruins" |
| Altered Carbon | Richard K. Morgan | Human consciousness can be transferred between bodies, allowing immortality | "A breakneck-paced crime thriller" - The Guardian |
| Old Man's War | John Scalzi | Seniors join the military and are given new bodies to fight in an interstellar war | "A must-read for science fiction fans" - Booklist |
| The City and the Stars | Arthur C. Clarke | People live indefinitely in a future city called Diaspar | "A visionary work of science fiction" - Los Angeles Times |
| The First Immortal | James L. Halperin | The first human to become immortal struggles with the consequences | "A compelling and thought-provoking novel" - Publishers Weekly |
| The Boat of a Million Years | Poul Anderson | A group of immortals must navigate their way through history and a changing world | "A masterful tour de force of storytelling" - Library Journal |
| A World Out of Time | Larry Niven | A man is cryogenically frozen and wakes up in a far-future world where he is immortal | "A classic of science fiction" - Publishers Weekly |
| Time Enough for Love | Robert A. Heinlein | A man who has lived for over 2,000 years recounts his life and loves | "A richly imaginative novel" - Library Journal |
| To Live Forever | Jack Vance | A man becomes obsessed with immortality and will do anything to achieve it | "A fascinating study of human obsession" - Kirkus Reviews |

I hope this extended list helps!
